title: Tom Brady ‘was supposed’ to play for Raiders upon leaving Patriots, Las Vegas owner Mark Davis said
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Tom Brady nearly signed with the Las Vegas Raiders in 2020, but the team chose a different direction.
Brady became a minority owner of the Raiders in May 2023 after retiring from playing in the NFL.
NFL amended 'Brady rules,' allowing him to attend broadcast production meetings as FOX's NFL commentator.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Friendship is a new comedic movie starring Tim Robinson and Paul Rudd, available on HBO Max.
Spike Lee's 'Highest 2 Lowest' featuring Denzel Washington is streaming on Apple TV+.
The Great British Baking Show's 16th season is now available on Netflix.

title: What Jakobi Meyers and the Raiders are saying about the Patriots ahead of season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Jakobi Meyers and Pete Carroll return to Foxborough as the Raiders face the Patriots in the season opener.
New Raiders head coach Pete Carroll notes New England's strong running game and formidable front seven.
Jakobi Meyers, formerly of the Patriots, expresses mixed emotions about playing against his former team.

title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown and YouTuber IShowSpeed streamed live from Boston, recreating the Boston Tea Party by tossing tea into the water.
Brown and IShowSpeed also engaged in a Muay Thai session before racing in Downtown Crossing, with IShowSpeed narrowly winning.
Brown jokingly contested IShowSpeed's race victory in a social media post, suggesting a name change due to a pulled hamstring.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell, the No. 4 pick in the 2025 NFL Draft, is set to debut against the Raiders.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's performance, noting his skills as a dynamic run blocker and great finisher.
Campbell received high grades from Pro Football Focus in pass and run blocking during preseason actions.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel commented on Bill Belichick's ban of Patriots scouts at UNC, stating it's their decision.
Bill Belichick restricted Patriots scouts after his contentious departure from New England, citing unfair treatment.
Patriots scouts can request UNC player film but can't attend practices or games, per Herald report.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Jane Doe sues University of Rhode Island for being filmed in dorm's unisex shower, claims defamation and negligence.
Incident involved man allegedly filming her with cellphone in Adams Hall bathroom, identified as 30-year-old James Paquette.
Doe's scholarship reinstated after lawsuit; seeks university action on security in all-gender facilities, claims distress and defamation.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener due to a hamstring injury that sidelined him since July.
Rookie tackle Will Campbell is questionable for Sunday's game against the Raiders with an ankle injury.
The Patriots' secondary sees changes with Carlton Davis joining while Jabrill Peppers and Kyle Dugger are out.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum is progressing in recovery from Achilles tear; moving better, says teammate Jordan Walsh.
The Celtics have not set a timeline for Tatum's return after his injury during the Eastern Conference Semifinals.
With Tatum's future uncertain, Boston's young roster is poised to take up larger roles in the upcoming season.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Tom Brady, a minority owner of the Raiders, won't attend the game against the Patriots due to broadcasting duties.
Raiders' new head coach Pete Carroll reunites with quarterback Geno Smith, aiming to replicate their past success with Seattle Seahawks.
Rookie Ashton Jeanty, favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year, aims to boost the Raiders' rushing game against Patriots.
